Frame Processor

Frame Processor class file.

Authors:

  • Giuseppe Boccignone <giuseppe.boccignone@unimi.it>

  • Renato Nobre <renato.avellarnobre@studenti.unimi.it>

Changes:

  • 12/12/2012 First Edition Matlab

  • 31/05/2022 Python Edition

class frame_processor.FrameProcessor[source]

Set of functions to handle image input and create frames.

This class has functions to create the window size frame from images in a local dir, apply foveated filtering to a frame, reduce the frame size and increase image size.

n_frames

Number of frames to process in a step.

Type

int

frame_offset

Offset between frames.

Type

int

img_list

List of images in the local dir.

Type

list

total_frames

Total number of images in the local dir.

Type

int

n_rows

Number of rows in the image.

Type

int

n_cols

Number of columns in the image.

Type

int

I

3 time-step frame.

Type

np.ndarray

foveated_I

3 time-step foveated frame.

Type

np.ndarray

show_frame

Current frame for visualization.

Type

np.ndarray

show_foveated_frame

Current foveated frame for visualization.

Type

np.ndarray

frame_resize_orginal(frame)[source]

Resize frame to original size

Use bilinear interpolation

Parameters

frame (np.ndarray) – Small size frame

Returns

np.ndarray – Original size frame

read_frames(frame_idx)[source]

Read current, next and previous image, creating a frame.

Reading include opening the files, converting them to grayscale, and creating a 3 time-step frame.

Note

Also save the frames in the object instance.

Parameters

frame_idx (int) – Current frame indices

Returns

I – Grayscale image frame

foveated_imaging(foa, I)[source]

Apply foveated imaging to the Grayscale frame.

To convert to the foveated version this function apply a gaussian filter in the field of attention (foa) of the image.

Parameters

  • foa (np.ndarray) – Field of attention.

  • I (np.ndarray) – Grayscale frame

Note

Also save the frames in the object instance.

Returns

Foveated frame

reduce_frames(foveated_I, reduced_rows=64, reduced_cols=64)[source]

Reduce the frame to a desired size.

The main purpose of this reduction is to compute the features.

Parameters

  • foveated_I (np.ndarray) – Frame to be reduced.

  • reduced_rows (int, optional) – Final desired row size. Defaults to 64.

  • reduced_cols (int, optional) – Final desired col size. Defaults to 64.

Returns

The reduced frame.
